issue.title: This is awesome.
issue.body:
Oh and 
        title = result[u'pagemap'][u'qapage'][0][u'title']
        description = result[u'pagemap'][u'qapage'][0][u'description']

don't work anymore. Seems to work without those though.

issue.title: Single line comments block first line of code
issue.body:
E.g., for https://stackoverflow.com/a/15978154/2689923, the first line of each code block gets commented out by the make comment character, "`#`":

```
 39 #Now for building unistd_32.h:                                                  
 40 #F1_EXISTS=$(shell [ -e /usr/include/asm/unistd_32.h ] && echo 1 || echo 0 )    
 41 ifeq ($(F1_EXISTS), 1)                                                          
 42     $(info Copying custom header)                                               
 43     $(shell sed -e 's/__NR_/__NR32_/g' /usr/include/asm/unistd_32.h > unistd_32.h)
 44 else                                                                            
 45     F2_EXISTS=$(shell [[ -e /usr/include/asm-i386/unistd.h ]] && echo 1 || echo 0 )
 46     ifeq ($(F2_EXISTS), 1)                                                      
 47         $(info Copying custom header)                                           
 48         $(shell sed -e 's/__NR_/__NR32_/g' /usr/include/asm-i386/unistd.h > unistd_32.h)
 49     else                                                                        
 50         $(error asm/unistd_32.h and asm-386/unistd.h does not exist)            
 51     endif                                                                       
 52 endif 
```

This isn't a fatal bug, it's just annoying. I'll fix it soon.

issue.title: Add comments for more languages and fix single-line comment quirks
issue.body:
- Add comment characters for CUDA, Makefile filetypes
- Add search mapping for Makefile (search query has "make" -> "Makefile")
- Force lower case on all language options (in case someone writes "CPP")
- Fix quirk with single-line comment getting prepended to start of a code block

issue.title: Single line comments block first line of code
issue.body:
E.g., for https://stackoverflow.com/a/15978154/2689923, the first line of each code block gets commented out by the make comment character, "`#`":

```
 39 #Now for building unistd_32.h:                                                  
 40 #F1_EXISTS=$(shell [ -e /usr/include/asm/unistd_32.h ] && echo 1 || echo 0 )    
 41 ifeq ($(F1_EXISTS), 1)                                                          
 42     $(info Copying custom header)                                               
 43     $(shell sed -e 's/__NR_/__NR32_/g' /usr/include/asm/unistd_32.h > unistd_32.h)
 44 else                                                                            
 45     F2_EXISTS=$(shell [[ -e /usr/include/asm-i386/unistd.h ]] && echo 1 || echo 0 )
 46     ifeq ($(F2_EXISTS), 1)                                                      
 47         $(info Copying custom header)                                           
 48         $(shell sed -e 's/__NR_/__NR32_/g' /usr/include/asm-i386/unistd.h > unistd_32.h)
 49     else                                                                        
 50         $(error asm/unistd_32.h and asm-386/unistd.h does not exist)            
 51     endif                                                                       
 52 endif 
```

This isn't a fatal bug, it's just annoying. I'll fix it soon.

issue.title: Make :cnext, unimpaired.vim (]q, [q) move between question answers
issue.body: This could either put it directly inside your code, and you fiddle between the different options, or they put the answers in a different pane, and you can flip between them.

issue.title: Make :cnext, unimpaired.vim (]q, [q) move between question answers
issue.body: This could either put it directly inside your code, and you fiddle between the different options, or they put the answers in a different pane, and you can flip between them.

issue.title: Make :cnext, unimpaired.vim (]q, [q) move between question answers
issue.body: This could either put it directly inside your code, and you fiddle between the different options, or they put the answers in a different pane, and you can flip between them.

issue.title: Flag to disable default language
issue.body: When you just want to see a generic answer to something, it would be useful to have a flag that turns off any specific language (so nothing is appended to your search). The workaround is to just put "-l the" at the start of your query, but this feels a bit hacky.

issue.title: Add option for no language
issue.body:
By calling:
```
:GSO -l no My search query
```
Even if you are inside a file with a known syntax, GSO will not append anything to your search and will not wrap answer text with language-specific comments.

`-l nothing` and `-l none` also work.

issue.title: vimrc setting flags
issue.body:
It would be nice to have vimrc flags to set default flags for searches.

E.g., say you never want to view the answer text, just the code, then you could turn on the --no-text flag by default, and not have to type "-n" every time. Similarly for future boolean flags. Then by typing "-n", you could negate your default setting.
